metadata.title: CVE-2023-37212 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 114. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort someof these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 115.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-37212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 115.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
firefox-geckodriver - 115.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
firefox-mozsymbols - 115.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '115.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.3').
